summary: Skam fans in real life: I watch a superb series online that consists of 8 international versions in 7 different languages. I’m...
body:
Skam fans in real life: I watch a superb series online that consists of 8 international versions in 7 different languages. I’m so delighted that they all have subtitles and are not dubbed. It is a lovely show and I highly recommend it

Skam fans on Tumblr: OMFG did you see what happened holy shit I ship them SO MUCH in this version yaaaaassss they finally got together they’re soulm8s WHEN THE FUCK IS THE NEXT CLIP DROPPING?!!?!

blog.name: niffineliot
blog.title: alohomora!
blog.description:
☼ abbie ☼ 21 ☼ irish ☼ she/they ☼ bi ☼ aries ☼ ravenclaw ☼ intp ☼ multifandom/interest ☼
♥ sidebar credit: centorame ♥

question: 💌meeting the parents💌
answer:
#1

Eliott meets Lucas’s dad on a grey, unseasonably rainy day in central Paris around four months after him and Lucas start officially dating. They three of them meet up for a coffee and a catch-up; Lucas had been wary before, tried to put this off as long as possible. He was unwilling at first to bring Eliott into his mess of a home life, but the older boy had insisted that it’d be fine; that he wanted to know Lucas inside and out, as much as he was comfortable with.

It was a perfectly pleasant half an hour, but not exactly illuminating. He was polite - paid for their drinks and did all the expected stuff like asking him about school, his parents and his hobbies. But there was a certain lack of warmth about the man, even when addressing his own son, that made Eliott uneasy. Like this whole situation was some sort of formality. His and Lucas’s exchanges seemed marred with an edge of tension, no matter how much they seemed to try and play nice. Eliott couldn’t help but notice Lucas clenching his jaw and starting to fidget with his fingers under the table towards the end of the meeting.

By the time they were getting the metro back to Lucas’s it was rush hour, so was busy enough that they had to stand. And maybe Eliott stood a little closer than was really necessary, and pulled Lucas against his chest with one hand, silently resting his chin on the shorter boy’s shoulder. 

Lucas didn’t say anything in response, only sighed and closed his eyes for a moment, laying his hand lightly on top of Eliott’s where it rested against his belly.

#2

Eliott is yet to meet Lucas’s maman. He’ll let him take that decision very much at his own pace.

#3

When it came to meeting Eliott’s parents, only a couple of weeks after making their relationship ‘official’, Lucas’s belly was filled with nervous butterflies from the moment he woke up the morning of. Despite his nerves, this is definitely something he wants to do.

At first, Mr and Mrs Demaury are cautious, without being stand-offish. They were well aware of their son’s tendency to wear his heart on his sleeve and become infatuated at the drop of a hat, and of the events surrounding Lucas and Eliott coming together. They were concerned for his well-being, if slightly overprotective. But Lucas understands - they’ve barely been together any time at all and he feels the inexplicable need to protect Eliott to some extent too.

They had liked Lucille. They had trusted Lucille.

But, starting with a homemade dinner in their slightly cramped dining room (books piled high everywhere - the stereotypical home of two academics), they started on the road to eventually liking and trusting him too. Lucas had been nervous at first, but soon eased into conversation with Mrs Demaury about their shared interest in/skills on the piano (and her joking disdain that Eliott never quite took to it himself) and Mr Demaury about his love of science, all discussed with the comforting pressure of Eliott’s hand resting casually on his upper thigh under the table.

The night drawing to a natural close, Eliott and his father exited to the kitchen with the dirty dishes and Lucas was left alone in the hallway with Mrs Demaury as he readied himself to leave. She turned and asked him softly, “Will you look after him?”

Lucas just smiles slightly and nods. Internally amused at how much Eliott himself would resent the question, but sensing how much she cared about her son (and the pain it caused in his own chest thinking back to his own situation) and how much it mattered to her, he replied

“We look after each other. Don’t worry”

summary: I hate this part of the season because you know everything Lucas is doing has a reason and you want to protect him from this...
body: I hate this part of the season because you know everything Lucas is doing has a reason and you want to protect him from this evil world, but on the other hand he’s acting like a douche and you want to sit him down and have a talk about how you don’t hurt other people on purpose.

summary: yes regarding skam France on YouTube : if you use desktop (and google chrome) there’s an auto translate option that will...
question: yes regarding skam France on YouTube : if you use desktop (and google chrome) there’s an auto translate option that will translate it into any language available on google translate. In addition to this people usually go on and add their own english subtitles that properly translate the slang and everything, it may just take a little bit. but the auto translate option allows you to at least mostly understand what’s happening right as the clip comes out!!
answer: i learn something new every day. thanks!

summary: This shot hurts me the most. Eliott was nervous about talking to Lucas in front of his friends and when Lucas shuts him down he...
body: This shot hurts me the most. Eliott was nervous about talking to Lucas in front of his friends and when Lucas shuts him down he quickly glances at them to see if they’re laughing at him. He feels totally embarrassed. :(  (Gif credit @dinglecrain)

summary: I think the way Lucas reacted was more violent and so direct comparing to the scene with Isak and Even. I don't know if it's...
body: I think the way Lucas reacted was more violent and so direct comparing to the scene with Isak and Even. I don’t know if it’s because of the language (like really, what Lucas said to Eliott was really unwelcoming comparing to Isak and Even, those two had this ambiguity around them, but for Lucas and Eliott it was really harsh ahah) but I felt it, and I think their relationship is gonna be kind of different and I’m kind of curious about it.
